p: For SDMs regularization, we smoothed the models to avoid over-parameterization [43], [48]. The regularization refers to smoothing the model, making it more regular, so as to avoid fitting too complex a model [48]. In Maxent, the fit of the model is measured at the occurrence sites, using a “log likelihood” (see Box 1 in [48]). A highly complex model will have a high log likelihood, but may not generalize well [43], [48]. The aim of regularization is to trade off model fit and model complexity [43], [48]. The smoothing was achieved by modifying a β parameter i.e. the value that smoothens the model, making it more regular. β = 1 was the best choice as it led to the most conservative model [48], penalizing over-parameterization ( Table 1).
